cot_content: We need to compute 66666 hex to decimal? Wait base-16 number 66666 means hex digits 6 6 6 6 6. That's hex value. We need number of bits in its binary representation. Compute value: hex 6=6 decimal. So number is 6*16^4 +6*16^3+6*16^2+6*16+6. 16^0=1. Compute powers: 16^2=256, 16^3=4096, 16^4=65536. So value =6*(65536+4096+256+16+1)=6*(699? sum: 65536+4096=69632; +256=69888; +16=69904; +1=69905. So 6*69905=419430. Wait 69905*6= 6*70000-6*95=420000-570=419430. yes. So decimal value 419430. Need number of bits in binary representation of 419430. Determine highest power of 2 <= value. 2^19=524288 >419430. 2^18=262144. 2^19 too high. So value uses 19 bits? Actually if value is less than 2^19 and >=2^18, binary representation will have 19 bits (since highest bit position 18 (0-index) plus leading 1). Number of bits = floor(log2(n))+1. Log2(419430) ≈ 18.x. Since 2^18=262144, 2^19=524288. So floor(log2)=18. So bits=19. So answer: 19 bits.
sentences: We need to compute 66666 hex to decimal?
Wait base-16 number 66666 means hex digits 6 6 6 6 6. That's hex value.
We need number of bits in its binary representation.
Need number of bits in binary representation of 419430.
Determine highest power of 2 <= value. 2^19=524288 >419430. 2^18=262144. 2^19 too high.
Actually if value is less than 2^19 and >=2^18, binary representation will have 19 bits (since highest bit position 18 (0-index) plus leading 1).
Number of bits = floor(log2(n))+1. Log2(419430) ≈ 18.x. Since 2^18=262144, 2^19=524288. So floor(log2)=18. So bits=19.
